title: How to Make a Phone Camera Into Night Vision

steps.headline: Get your hands on an old mobile phone.
steps.description: Remember, this hack isn't really reversible so don't do this on a camera you want to use in the future.

steps.headline: Open up the phone with a screwdriver and find the camera.
The camera will have an unscrew-able lid where the lens is.
steps.description: Unscrew it and remove the plastic containing the lens. Make sure not to let any dust fall onto the shiny CMOS sensor inside.

steps.headline: On the bottom of the part you just removed, you'll find a transparent disc stuck near the lens.
steps.description: This is the infra-red filter. You have to remove this by applying some pressure on it sideways till the glue gives way and it comes off.

steps.headline: Once this is removed, close the camera and close up the phone.
Buy a couple of IR LEDs or pull one out from an old TV remote.
steps.description: Connect the LEDs in parallel to a battery of about 3-5 volts. It's better to use more than one in parallel to spread out the current equally. Test the LEDs by looking at them through any a digital camera.

steps.headline: Mount the LEDs on a holder and secure the phone inside it.
Turn on the camera and LEDs on and put the lights off.
steps.description: You now have an infra-red night vision Camera.

text: Get your hands on an old mobile phone. Remember, this hack isn't really reversible so don't do this on a camera you want to use in the future. Open up the phone with a screwdriver and find the camera.  The camera will have an unscrew-able lid where the lens is. Unscrew it and remove the plastic containing the lens. Make sure not to let any dust fall onto the shiny CMOS sensor inside. On the bottom of the part you just removed, you'll find a transparent disc stuck near the lens. This is the infra-red filter. You have to remove this by applying some pressure on it sideways till the glue gives way and it comes off. Once this is removed, close the camera and close up the phone.  Buy a couple of IR LEDs or pull one out from an old TV remote. Connect the LEDs in parallel to a battery of about 3-5 volts. It's better to use more than one in parallel to spread out the current equally. Test the LEDs by looking at them through any a digital camera. Mount the LEDs on a holder and secure the phone inside it.  Turn on the camera and LEDs on and put the lights off. You now have an infra-red night vision Camera.
